{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3130035,"name":"","username":"Boyvoy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T22:14:20.343Z","cooked":"

We are using PhotonVision on Limelight 2, and doing pose estimate with April tag 3D detection mode.
Everything running fine with one camera, but when we add a second camera the process crushed.
Anyone had a success with similar setup? Any advice?
Thanks

hi thanks for your help, when we try to run 2 pipelines with different cameras on the LL2+ the limelight would just shutdown. the two pipelines is running a apriltag 3d detection. our other camera is life cam that is connected to the limelight in the usb a port.

we looked into it some more,
first of all we found and internal error log that you might be able to make sense of.
secondly it seems that whether or not it crashes is somewhat random so to reproduce the crash we have to reconnect the second amera multiple times at which point the photonvision process will shutdown and restart

Can you try running Photon manually? here’s a fun little incantation to do that for you

sudo service photonvision stop
cd /opt/photonvision
LIBCAMERA_LOG_LEVELS=*:DEBUG sudo java -jar -Xmx512m photonvision.jar

You should see a lot more output come out. If you do, run this

LIBCAMERA_LOG_LEVELS=*:DEBUG sudo java -jar -Xmx512m photonvision.jar > out.txt

and send out.txt here?

How stable are your pose estimates?

We are trying to calibrate Limelight’s own software for all this (single tag, single camera field pose estimate), and with half-field distance the results start “dancing” quite a bit (meaning - the pose estimate changes rapidly and to the numbers greater than, say, 0.1m).
